clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Intravascular Hypothermia Therapy in Acute Ischemic Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Randomized Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Intravascular Hypothermia Therapy of Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: Cerebral stroke (stroke) is a group of diseases whose main clinical manifestations are cerebral hemorrhage and ischemic injury symptoms. It has a very high mortality and disability rate and is one of the most important fatal diseases in the world. From the previous domestic and foreign literatures, hypothermia can prevent and treat secondary injury caused by ischemia-reperfusion injury and cerebral edema of acute cerebral ischemia. Prevent and treat ischemia-reperfusion injury and secondary injury caused by cerebral edema caused by acute cerebral ischemia, so as to achieve the role of brain protection. In this study, intravascular cooling was used. As soon as possible, intravascular cooling was performed during thrombectomy and temperature management was performed. The temperature was controlled at 33 ° C for 48-72 hours. The study is a parallel controlled study to systematically study the effects of vascular hypothermia and early hypothermia treatment on ischemic stroke reperfusion. Research treatment results and explore hypothermia treatment options to provide more solutions for brain protection and improve patient prognosis.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the target patients were patients with moderate or severe acute stroke who were satisfied with mTICI 2b-3 reperfusion. Ultra-early intravascular hypothermia brain protection therapy was given to patients with intravascular hypothermia during thrombectomy to evaluate its safety and effectiveness.To study the cerebral protective effect of endovascular hypothermia therapy, the improvement in bleeding conversion rate, the improvement in infarct volume and cerebral edema, the improvement in prognosis quality of life and neurological function recovery, as well as the improvement in mortality and disability rate, etc., the specific evaluation criteria are detailed in the following experimental design.The endovascular hypothermia treatment of ischemia-reperfusion patients was explored.

primary_outcome.description: Compare intracranial hemorrhages conversion rate between study group and control group

secondary_outcome.description: Compare the rate of 90-day mRS (0-2) between the two groups
Compare infarct volume between two groups
Compare brain edema (incidence and volume)between two groups
Compare the incidence of lung infection between groups

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age between 18 and 80 years old;
2. ASPECTS score 5-10.
3. Subjects with acute onset stroke in the 0-24 hours time window from symptom onset to femoral artery puncture, internal carotid artery or middle cerebral artery M1 or M2 segment occlusion.
4. (NIHSS) score ≥ 13, with or without intravenous t-PA treatment
5. The subject' recanalization of vessel achieves mTICI 2b-3, the subject has not type II parenchymal hematoma (PH2) in CT examination. If the subject' recanalization of vessel could not achieve mTICI 2b-3, the subject could not enter the per-protocol analysis and will separate another group.
6. Informed consent form signed by subjects or their legal guardian .
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject who suffer serious infection, multiple organ failure. 2. Subject who need to place the inferior vena cava filter. 3. Subject who suffer from late renal failure who require dialysis. 5. Subjects known to be allergic to study medical devices, related products and medicine; 6. Subjects known active bleeding or known bleeding tendency (eg, preoperative anticoagulant therapy or coagulation dysfunction before operation, INR > 3.0); 8. Subjects with the history of platelet count lower than 40×10^9/L; 9. Subject with the history of ventricular arrhythmia leading to cardiac arrest; 10. Subjects with blood glucose concentration <2.7 or> 22.2 mmol / L; 11. Life expectancy <6 months; 12. Subjects with known dementia or mental illness cannot complete neurological function assessment; 13. Subjects not included for other reasons from the investigators.
